content: Yes, there are many other examples of medicines and drugs that come from nature. One example is aspirin, which is derived from salicylic acid found in the bark of willow trees. Another example is quinine, which is derived from the bark of the cinchona tree and is used to treat malaria. Many antibiotics, such as penicillin and streptomycin, are also derived from natural sources such as bacteria and fungi. Additionally, many traditional medicines and remedies from different cultures have long used plant and animal-derived substances for their therapeutic properties.
